website_summaries.verdict: A powerhouse that comes with every feature – and a huge price tag to match.
pros: Unique styling and 46-speaker internals make this an elegant and remarkably capable sound bar
cons: Twice the price of comparable sound bars
Dolby Atmos effects are simulated with up-firing speakers and may not perform well in all environments

website_summaries.verdict: The Yamaha YSP-5600 projects a huge sound field -- no other sound bar can produce as immersive an experience -- but it can sound thin, and dynamic punch is limited.
pros: The Yamaha YSP-5600 is the first sound bar to offer Dolby Atmos and DTS:X support
It gives more spacious and immersive surround effects than any other sound bar we've tested
The system includes Yamaha's MusicCast, one of the better multiroom music systems
With four 4K-ready HDMI inputs you can use the sound bar as a switch for your home theater, which is unusual
cons: As sound bars go it's really tall and expensive, and you'll need to add a subwoofer
It needs to be wall-mounted as it can move around the tabletop when bumped
Some cheaper sound bars have better overall audio quality

customer_reviews.title: Only one hdmi input is HDCP 2. 2 compatible ...
customer_reviews.text: Only one hdmi input is HDCP 2.2 compatible, which means if you have more than one 4K device you will need to buy an HDMI switch. It also doesn't pass thru HDR which is a deal breaker for 4K.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Impressive.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so this is not the greatest sound bar to date but it sure might be the most expensive. It does work. The 3D surround technology was impressive and I have it set up in a non-standard room with limited wall space behind me for 'bouncing' the sounds. Right out of the box the surround was impressive. After I used the built in system to fine-tune the surround, it was worse. I deleted the tune and went with stock. Tested it listening to Logan and John Wick. The surround was impressive. I was not so sure until the pool-bar scene in Logan where I could hear the pool tables behind me. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: seabumb

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SOUND BAR---Only Worked 6 Months....It is junk!
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 months my Yamaha YSP-5600BL HDMI inputs all went dead, no video and no sound! I called Yamaha factory service in California and was put on hold for better than 45 minutes, so I hung up. I called Yamaha several times and got connected to their call back service. I missed that call back and they failed to leave any message. I'm very disappointed Yamaha makes it difficult and time consuming to get warranty service authorization so I can have my sound bar repaired.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY T.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound and great dialogue clarity with 'clear voice' mode
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from a ysp-5100, I'm very happy with the sound quality of my new 5600. I am using a Yamaha FSW-050 sub-woofer (which i can highly recommend), and is a must in the setup. A smaller space such as mine doesn't require or allow for a bigger sub. I'm not using the HDMI switching, most of my audio is via the optical connections. I may change this later, but opted for easy. Wireless connectivity to the speaker is very good. The app is very basic and a bit lame, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Conan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: In typical Yamaha fashion, the synthetic surround works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sounds great for midrange to high frequencies 3D (height) channels do a good job of localizing sound around me Lots of connection options Cons: Expensive Large Inadequate bass - Absolutely requires a subwoofer Wall mounting bracket not included Remote not lighted
customer_reviews.author: P. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing. I hooked up a wireless sub to add ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds amazing. I hooked up a wireless sub to add some extra bass. Keeps the living room looking sharp without all of the extra wires and speakers associated with surround sound.
customer_reviews.author: John Schnorr

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed and out a lot of money!
customer_reviews.text: Very bulky and too expensive for mediocre sound quality. I have the primary HDMI source going into the speaker first then to the TV as recommended and it still is not impressive. Expected to have a great sound experience for the price, number of embedded speakers and technology. I have an 6 year old Samsung soundbar that sounds nearly as good at 1/4th the price. Also the HDMI-CEC isn't reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Bar, Amazon used like new has some faults.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used like new from Amazon.. overall it was in excellent condition no scratches or marks anywhere.. however it did not come with the proper remote for the unit, it was for a different Yamaha unit not the 5600.. I ended up returning it and purchasing a brand new one from my friend for the price I paid for this used one.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Chef

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D soundbar, love it
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha YSP 5600BL soundbar system is one of the best for 7.1.2 Dolby and Atmos sound. Could hear the planes, mortars, rocket, and helicopters with gun fire overhead. Only wish I had the other 2 balk ceiling speakers to get the 7.1.4 full effect. That would have been assume.
customer_reviews.author: Ano

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this unit!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this over a month now. It works perfectly and sounds great. For me it is the best option to purchasing a receiver and in-walls. Awesome sound and easy setup for listening to music or home theater!
customer_reviews.author: Denver Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck in home theater
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar completely changed the viewing experience. Incredible build and sound quality for a great price. The technology in this soundbar makes sounds feel like they are coming from all over the room.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Pessatore

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great but does not do HDR passthrough
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, returned it. Sounds great but does not do HDR passthrough.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzysmith

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great and it’s a good alternative to a full surround system in my parent’s media room.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Blue tooth drops connection
customer_reviews.text: Blue tooth constantly drops, and then reconnects and after a 15 second pause , not just from one device but have tried multiple devices.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Theater sound.
customer_reviews.text: 3D sound imaging with Dolby Atmos will capture every ones attention as one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Soundbar EVER.
customer_reviews.text: WOW. Just WOW! I have had many different sound systems in the past, but got tired of running wires or shoddy wireless signals to the rear speakers. My previous soundbar was a NIRO SSS which was nearly $2,000 but never had the sound quality of this Yamaha. This is truly the first soundbar that fulfills my need for surround sound without requiring multiple speakers around the room. You will need the subwoofer, though, to get the full effect.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great sound especially after I added a subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: Really big! Great sound especially after I added a subwoofer. A little pricey but worth it if you don't want to run wiring for in wall speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Criswell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent soundbar for someone who wants Dolby Atmos but can't install a traditional set of seven or more speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: terrible product if you want to use the musiccast feature ...
customer_reviews.text: terrible product if you want to use the musiccast feature to connect to other yahama devices. there is a delay when transmitting over the wireless network that results in a very annoying echo when you transition from one room to another.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: Zero support from Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: My 5600, bought through Amazon, worked properly less than 7 months. Now it will not turn on. I have spent hours troubleshooting after reading a 110 page manual, and it is impossible to even chat with support! Beware...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Number of connection options is a great benefit.
customer_reviews.text: Like of HDR Audio pass through. Otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptional sound projector. You definitely need a subwoofer to balance everything out. I went from a 7.1 system to this and I'm not looking back. Happy I made the purchase. It will not pass HDR, but with the oppo ubd-203 4k player you can send HDR video to your 4k tv and audio to the 5600. No big deal. I've placed it in front of a 9" riser because it is 81/2 inches tall.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in product and support service...
customer_reviews.text: When the bar "works" it sounds great, however, it's died twice. I was told by Yamaha, "service" was not done on sound bars, instead replaced. Approx 6 months in it stopped working altogether. Yamaha made me drive 4 hours to get it serviced at a service center. A week ago it died again and I'm still waiting on a return label as they refuse to ship me a new replacement first.
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: No HDR. Dated!!
customer_reviews.text: The lack of HDR support is unfortunate! Yamaha’s unwillingness to produce a new version with HDR passthrough is also unfortunate! This is would be a near perfect solution for homes that do not wish to run traditional 5.1 or 7.1 systems. So here is my epic frustration. I could connect my Xbox One S directly to my Vizio M Series tv, but in doing so I lose Atmos compatibility! That really sucks!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Schrall

customer_reviews.title: You need Rear speakers
customer_reviews.text: Played Transformers 4 ATMOS. Sounds ok and kind of does work to project the sounds around the walls, but I felt I really needed rear speakers to enhance the sound immersion. Also, you need to spend $400 for the subwoofer, so the total cost reaches $2000. I ended up getting the new Samsung ATMOS 950k. That sounds better as it has rear speakers to fully envelope you.
customer_reviews.author: paradise

customer_reviews.title: great sound bar but no HDR makes it outdated
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest you look for a samsung k950 or the sony ST5000 this thing is missing the latest feature which is HDR. it can't do HDR passthrough so you'd be wasting your money if you pay 1500 for this
customer_reviews.author: Marc H. Alcide

customer_reviews.title: I really like the sound with an additional subwoofer but
customer_reviews.text: I really like the sound with an additional subwoofer but.... There appears to be a number of firmware issues which make it much more difficult to use and impossible for someone who is not tech savvy. When using it with an Amazon Dot through Bluetooth, it will not play sound until you go through multiple gyrations of switching it off/on and then changing the input. When using ARC, the sound will not come through the speaker until you hit HDMI1. These are all firmware issues but have not seen updates to fix any of them. I hope Yamaha fixes them!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty tall. airply works well. sounds great. my second yamaha sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Harris

product_meta.title: YAMAHA YSP-5600BL 7.1.2-Channel Dolby Atmos MusicCast Sound Bar
product_meta.description: Take your TV sound to a new dimension. The YSP-5600 employs a remarkable 46 speaker drivers and Yamaha exclusive Digital Sound Projector technology to deliver Dolby Atmos and DTS:X multi-dimensional listening experiences. It can also provide wireless multiroom audio playback using your existing Wi-Fi network by adding other Music Cast speakers, sound bars or AV receivers in other rooms.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately)
World's first sound bar with 7.1.2 channel multi dimensional sound
HDMI inputs with 4K Ultra HD pass through and HDCP 2.2
Music Cast wireless multiroom audio system
Access to your music library, Pandora, Spotify, Rhapsody and more
Versatile connectivity Wi Fi, Bluetooth, Air Play and Spotify Connect

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
